[[File:Tahrir Square in 1941.jpg|thumb|Tahrir Square in 1941.]]
'''Tahrir Square''' ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ¯Ø§Ù Ø§ÙØªØ­Ø±ÙØ±}} ''{{transl|ar|DIN|MÄ«dÄn at-Taá¸¥rÄ«r}}'', {{IPA-arz|meËdÃ¦Ën ettÃ¦Ä§ËÉ¾iËÉ¾|IPA}}, {{lang-en|Liberation Square}}) is a major public [[town square]] in [[Downtown Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. The square was originally called ''Midan Ismaileyya'' ({{lang-en|Ismailia Square}}), after the 19th-century ruler [[Khedive Ismail]], who commissioned the new downtown district's 'Paris on the [[Nile]]' design. After the [[Egyptian Revolution of 1919]] the square became widely known as Tahrir (Liberation) Square, but the square was not officially renamed until the [[Egyptian Revolution of 1952]], which changed Egypt from a [[constitutional monarchy]] into a [[republic]]. The square was a focal point for the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011]].<ref>{{cite book |author=Vatikiotis, Panayiotis J. |title=The Middle East: From the End of Empire to the End of the Cold War |year=1997 |publisher=Routledge |pages=194 }}</ref>
'''Tahrir Square''' ({{lang-ar|ÙÙØ¯Ø§Ù Ø§ÙØªØ­Ø±ÙØ±}} ''{{transl|ar|DIN|MÄ«dÄn at-Taá¸¥rÄ«r}}'', {{IPA-arz|meËdÃ¦Ën ettÃ¦Ä§ËÉ¾iËÉ¾|IPA}}, {{lang-en|Liberation Square}}) is a major public [[town square]] in [[Downtown Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. The square was originally called ''Midan Ismaileyya'' ({{lang-en|Ismailia Square}}), after the 19th-century ruler [[Khedive Ismail]], who commissioned the new downtown district's 'Paris on the [[Nile]]' design. After the [[Egyptian Revolution of 1919]] the square became widely known as Tahrir (Liberation) Square, but the square was not officially renamed until the [[Egyptian Revolution of 1952]], which changed Egypt from a [[constitutional monarchy]] into a [[republic]]. The square was a focal point for the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011]].<ref>{{cite book |author=Vatikiotis, Panayiotis J. |title=The Middle East: From the End of Empire to the End of the Cold War |year=1997 |publisher=Routledge |pages=194 }}</ref>
==Features==
==Features==
â
[[File:Tahrir square Cairo1.jpg|thumb|right|View southwest across Tahrir Square]]
+
[[File:Talet harb roundabout-cairo-egypt.JPG|thumb|Tahrir Square at night with [[traffic circle]], view northwest from [[Talaat Harb Street]]]]
[[File:Modan Tahrir (2005-05-343).jpg|thumb|View south towards the [[The Mogamma|Mogamma]] building and Omar Makram statue]]
[[File:Modan Tahrir (2005-05-343).jpg|thumb|View south towards the [[The Mogamma|Mogamma]] building and Omar Makram statue]]
At the centre of Tahrir Square is a large and busy [[traffic circle]]. On the north-east side is a plaza with a statue of nationalist hero [[Alexandria expedition of 1807#Occupation of Rosetta|Omar Makram]], celebrated for his resistance against Napoleon I's invasion of Egypt, and beyond is the Omar Makram Mosque.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.touregypt.net/featurestories/midanaltahrir.htm |title=Midan Al-Tahrir, Liberation Square |publisher=Tour Egypt}}</ref>
At the centre of Tahrir Square is a large and busy [[traffic circle]]. On the north-east side is a plaza with a statue of nationalist hero [[Alexandria expedition of 1807#Occupation of Rosetta|Omar Makram]], celebrated for his resistance against Napoleon I's invasion of Egypt, and beyond is the Omar Makram Mosque.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.touregypt.net/featurestories/midanaltahrir.htm |title=Midan Al-Tahrir, Liberation Square |publisher=Tour Egypt}}</ref>
